simulation.gui
Class SimulationView

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  simulation.gui.ViewPanel
                      simulation.gui.SimulationView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, PhysicsListener
public class SimulationView
extends ViewPanel
implements PhysicsListener

This is the main view which shows a visual representation of the simulation. This serves as both a view and a controller -- it shows the user the simulation as well as letting the user interact with the objects.

Author:
Tikhon Jelvis
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

SimulationView

public SimulationView(Simulation model,
                      MainWindow mainWindow)
Creates a view of the specified simulation.

Parameters:
model - - the model which this instance shows.
Method Detail

addRectangle

public void addRectangle()
Lets the user add a rectangle to the simulation by clicking and dragging The add circle tool remains active until another tool is chosen or escape is pressed.

addCircle

public void addCircle()
Lets the user add a circle to the simulation by clicking and dragging. The add circle tool remains active until another tool is chosen or escape is pressed.

addPolygon

public void addPolygon()
Lets the user add a polygon to the simulation by clicking repeatedly. The add polygon tool remains active until another tool is chosen or escape is pressed. The polygon is created when enter is pressed.

stateChanged

public void stateChanged(PhysicsEvent e)
Description copied from interface: PhysicsListener
This method is fired when the simulation's state is changed. In general, a state change is any change that requires the simulation to be redrawn; however, other types of changes may appear in the future.

Specified by:
stateChanged in interface PhysicsListener
Parameters:
e - - the event, representing the change in state.

setActiveTool

public void setActiveTool(int activeTool)
Sets which tool is active. The active tool dictates what happens when the mouse is clicked. Supplying any number that doesn't correspond to a tool is the same as supplying NO_TOOL.

Parameters:
activeTool - - the tool that is now active.

getActiveTool

public int getActiveTool()
Returns the number that corresponds to the active tool. The active tool dictates what happens when the mouse is clicked.

Returns:
the number corresponding to the active tool.

setZoomFactor

public void setZoomFactor(double zoomFactor)
Changes the zoom factor of this view. The zoom factor describes how to scale the view relative to the simulation; a zoom factor of 1.0 means that it is identical in size, while a zoom factor of 2 means everything is twice as big and a zoom factor of 0.5 makes the view show twice as much.

Parameters:
zoomFactor - - the new zoom factor.

getZoomFactor

public double getZoomFactor()
Returns this view's zoom factor. The zoom factor describes how to scale the view relative to the simulation; a zoom factor of 1.0 means that it is identical in size, while a zoom factor of 2 means everything is twice as big and a zoom factor of 0.5 makes the view show twice as much.

Returns:
this view's zoom factor.

setXOffset

public void setXOffset(int xOffset)
Changes the view's x-offset.

Parameters:
xOffset - - the new x-offset.

getXOffset

public int getXOffset()
Returns the view's x-offset.

Returns:
the x-offset.

setYOffset

public void setYOffset(int yOffset)
Sets the view's y-offset.

Parameters:
yOffset - - the new y-offset.

getYOffset

public int getYOffset()
Returns the view's y-offset.

Returns:
the y-offset

addCameraListener

public void addCameraListener(CameraListener listener)
Registers the specified listener with this view.

Parameters:
listener - - the listener to add.

removeCameraListener

public void removeCameraListener(CameraListener listener)
Removes the specified listener. If it was registered more than once, only removes the first instance.

Parameters:
listener - - the listener to remove.

getCameraListeners

public CameraListener[] getCameraListeners()
Returns an array of all the CameraListeners registered to this view.

Returns:
an array of all the CameraListeners registered to this view.
